data.title: Electronicore ‚Äî Ian's Untitled Scene Show
data.text:
Viewing entries tagged

Electronicore

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! In this episode, I feature one of the most significant new bands in the scene, Until I Wake!

I caught up with the whole band (Cody, August, Ryan, and Alex) via Zoom to learn more about Until I Wake and their debut album ‚ÄòInside My Head‚Äô coming out September 9th through Fearless Records! If you don‚Äôt already know Until I Wake, you‚Äôre about to!

Check out the exclusive interview below, including iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher, and more:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music

Make sure to support Until I Wake in all they do! And, don‚Äôt forget, their debut album ‚ÄòInside My Head‚Äô comes out September 9th through Fearless Records! Check out all the ways to support them below:

Website ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Facebook ü§ò Twitter ü§ò Listen/Links

Also, building another brand is challenging. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

Facebook ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Twitter

Want to listen somewhere other than the website?

Subscribe on these sites:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music

Also, check out the new off-the-cuff 30-minute podcast Ian does on many topics called Kiss The Ring. You can‚Äôt listen on any of those sites, just on the website (still free as always):

Kiss The Ring Podcast

*The following episode of Ian Hates Music is opinion-based and does not necessarily represent the opinions of Ian Scene or any affiliates. Listen at your own risk. This is NOT an episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show. Enjoy.‚Äù

Ian Hates returns for this ‚Äúspecial event.‚Äù with another surprise return. There‚Äôs nothing else to give away here, so you‚Äôre just gonna have to get a sense of humor and listen to this comedy scene episode on the comedy scene band I Prevail‚Äôs new album ‚ÄòTrue Power‚Äô! I won‚Äôt apologize unless they do!

Listen on one of the sites below or by downloading the episode:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music

I was visited by the ghosts of Scene past, present, and future, and even though they agreed with all my opinions of the scene, the one thing they wanted from me was to stop trying to make everything perfect and just put out episodes without worrying about making them sound studio quality. So, here‚Äôs the end of 2020 episode with all the scars that the real 2020 has (i.e. no editing, you get what you get). No one seems to care when shows sound like it‚Äôs two guys in a bathroom stall and not humorous whatsoever, so why would you care that Dave is halfway across the country and there‚Äôs some background noise?

Anyway, I‚Äôm hanging out with the Scene ghosts right now listening to From First to Last and talking about how terrible Alt Press is. Enjoy the jokes and please stay safe and healthy this holiday season!

Happy Holidays!

Merry Christmas!

Happy New Year!

Stay Scene!

Building another brand is tough. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

It‚Äôs the end of the decade! Yes, it didn‚Äôt happen at the beginning of 2020, it happens at the end! To celebrate this oh so special of occasions, Dave put together his list of the worst scene albums of the decade! This is a really fun conversation, so go have some fun yourself and take a listen! Really, I think that‚Äôs all the hype you need.

Big shout out to Rick, who helps anytime I need a promo image! Thanks so much, man! Go follow him on Twitter!

Also, building another brand is tough. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music ü§ò Links

After the partial seriousness of Sheeps N Rubes - Part 1 of the new Ian Hates The Scene, it‚Äôs time to talk more scene music! Ian and Dave talk about some of their favorite recent singles and then a ton of album reviews! Here‚Äôs a quick list of what you have to look forward to, including everything else going on in the scene:

Broadside - Into the Raging Sea - Sharptone Creeper - Sex Death and the Infinite Void - Roadrunner If I Die First - My Poison Arms - Independent - EP Slaves - To Better Days - SBG Records S‚Äôefforcer - Lifeless - We Are Triumphant - EP Black Veil Brides - Re-Stitch These Wounds - Summerian In Hearts Wake - Kaliyuga - UNFD The Fall of Troy - Mukiltearth - Independent Curses - Chapter II: Bloom - Sharptone Year of the Knife - Internal Incarceration - Pure Noise Records Misery Signals - Ultraviolet - Independent

It‚Äôs time to talk a lot of awesome scene music and have some fun! (PS - the guys are tired AF after Part 1, haha)

TRIGGER WARNING: Do not take jokes Ian and Dave say seriously.

To quote the great scene band Chuggaboom, ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre easily offended, here‚Äôs your trigger warning‚Äù‚Ä¶Learn to take many fucking jokes, life will be better for you.

Listen to the exclusive show here (until some other show steals the content to use it as their own‚Ä¶). Also, available on Spotify, iTunes, and more, just look below:

Big shout out to two people who have helped the show greatly over the years. First up, Rick, who helps anytime I need a promo image! Thanks so much, man! Go follow him on Twitter!

Next up, a huge HAPPY BIRTHDAY to Megan! She‚Äôs been a constant supporter of mine and I appreciate her very much! She does crazy exercise stuff, so make sure to check out her website and support her!

Also, building another brand is tough. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

Facebook ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Twitter

Want to listen somewhere other than the website?

Subscribe on these sites:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music ü§ò Links

It‚Äôs a combination show of Ian Hates Music and Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show that results in, IAN HATES THE SCENE! Which of Ian‚Äôs personalities are talking, Ian Scene or Ian Hates? He‚Äôll never tell! Wow, that‚Äôs dumb. Anyway, Dave returns for a brand new combination show where we talk all the scene news that‚Äôs important right now, including but not limited to: streaming shows, backing tracks at live shows, idiots on Twitter, reaction videos, and recent allegations.

Lots of strong opinions and hopefully some jokes are on the way.

TRIGGER WARNING: Do not take jokes Ian and Dave say seriously. There is also a serious conversation about allegations in the scene. If you can‚Äôt handle a discussion and conversation on serious topics then don‚Äôt listen to this episode and check out Part 2. Part 2 focuses on new singles and album reviews! Maybe that‚Äôs more up your alley?

To quote the great scene band Chuggaboom, ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre easily offended, here‚Äôs your trigger warning‚Äù‚Ä¶Learn to take many fucking jokes, life will be better for you.

Listen to the exclusive show here (until some other show steals the content to use it as their own‚Ä¶). Also, available on Spotify, iTunes, and more, just look below:

Big shout out to two people who have helped the show greatly over the years. First up, Rick, who helps anytime I need a promo image! Thanks so much, man! Go follow him on Twitter!

Next up, a huge HAPPY BIRTHDAY to Megan! She‚Äôs been a constant supporter of mine and I appreciate her very much! She does crazy exercise stuff, so make sure to check out her website and support her!

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! In this episode, I feature Tom Kiely, vocalist for Patient Sixty-Seven!

All the way from Perth, Australia, Tom and I talk about what life has been like for him during covid times. We segue into the two re-recorded songs Patient Sixty-Seven have completed, called ‚ÄòImbalance Redux‚Äô. The final track of which, will be released THIS FRIDAY!

Of course, make sure you check that out. Tom and I also cover the status of the band, new music, the scene, and so much more! This was a lot of fun, so click below!

PS - New mic, who dis?

Check out the exclusive interview below, including iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher, and more:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music

Make sure to support Tom and Patient Sixty-Seven in all they do! And, don‚Äôt forget, the newest track ‚ÄòI Can Resist Anything, Except Temptation‚Äô from ‚ÄòImbalance Redux‚Äô comes out on August 14th! Check out all the ways to support them below:

Bandcamp ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Facebook ü§ò Twitter ü§ò Music

Also, building another brand is tough. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

IAN HATES HAS HIJACKED IAN‚ÄôS UNTITLED SCENE SHOW‚Ä¶again‚Ä¶again‚Ä¶!

This is a show Ian Hates has wanted to do for years and with a covid-19 pandemic out there, there‚Äôs no better time! Ian Hates (the bad one) and Ian Scene (the good one) welcome returning co-hosts Dave and Jackson as they take 32 of the most popular scene bands and whittle them down to‚Ä¶

The.

Single.

Worst.

Current.

Scene.

Band!

You read that correctly. Get ready for a lot of fun, scene knowledge, and a lot of strong opinions!

TRIGGER WARNING: Do not take things Ian, Dave, and Jackson say seriously. Ian, Dave, and Jackson also wish everyone impacted by covid-19 the best and a quick recovery. Stay safe and healthy out there everyone. A lot of people‚Äôs jobs are also affected (touring personnel, restaurant and bar staff, and so many more), so help out when you have the means. None of this works to say in a comedy show, but in the description, it does.

To quote the great scene band Chuggaboom, ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre easily offended, here‚Äôs your trigger warning‚Äù‚Ä¶Learn to take many fucking jokes, life will be better for you.

Listen to the exclusive show here (until some other show steals the content to use it as their own‚Ä¶). Also, available on Spotify, iTunes, and more, just look below:

Also, building another brand is tough. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

For some reason, Ian and James have trouble speaking in this episode of Ian Hates Music, but it turns out they have a lot to speak about, like, what the fuck is going on in the scene?!?!?

It‚Äôs like it‚Äôs war all of the time now.

Get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, nu-metal, and really, all the core you could ever want!

It's another FUCKING GREAT, FUCKING FREE (NSFW) episode of Ian Hates Music you say?!?! That's right! Ian and James talk your scene news from:

Disrupt Festival, Static-X, and As I Lay Dying‚Ä¶

And New Songs talk from:

Bad Religion, Death Therapy, Above A Whisper, Saving Vice, Wind Walkers, Frank Carter & The Rattlesnakes, Awake At Last, The Molten Larva, Rammstein, In Her Own Words, and LIMBS!

Add on album reviews from:

A Wake in Providence - The Blvck Sun II The Blood Moon - Outerloop Records

I Prevail - Trauma - Fearless Records

Whitechapel - The Valley - Metal Blade Records

Lotus Eater - Social Hazard - Hopeless Records

Low Dose - Low Dose - Brutal Panda Records

High Rise - Endeavours - EP - Independent Release

A Blessing A Curse - Waste - Smartpunk Records

Bloodline - Better View - Stay Sick Recordings

Plus, stuff and/or things and maybe some more!

Also, Ian has opened a Patreon to help with the costs of the many Ian Hates shows. If you have the means, please donate to keep the shows and quality going! Link below:

It‚Äôs time for a brand new episode of Ian Hates Music! James is back, Ian is still not 100% after being sick for a week and a half, but as Fronz says ‚ÄúIt Is What It Is‚Äù, so you may hear his voice give out every once in while (lucky you!)‚Ä¶The guys have all the fun scene news and some not so fun as well, so, you know what to do!

Get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, nu-metal, and really, all the core you could ever want!

It's another FUCKING GREAT, FUCKING FREE (NSFW) episode of Ian Hates Music you say?!?! That's right! Ian and James talk your scene news from:

The Ghost Inside, Ozzy, Breaking Benjamin, Marilyn Manson, A Day To Remember, Warped Tour, Doyle Wolfgang Von Frankenstein, The Word Alive, Blessthefall, Wage War, and a serious conversation (on a comedy show) about sexual misconduct/assault accusations in the scene. This is not a conversation about who is ‚Äúright‚Äù and who is ‚Äúwrong‚Äù. This conversation does not choose sides and does not expect you to either. It is an analytical conversation, all speculation, all opinion, on the current state of accusations that happen to take place in the scene. If you like an open conversation with no judgements that may actually be thought provoking, then this conversation is for you. If not, you can skip it and go on to New Songs. The entertainment show, known as Ian Hates Music, is normally a comedy show, but the co-hosts try to be open and honest and sometimes that means covering the big stories that involve a sensitive nature.

And New Songs talk from:

Born A New, Low Dose, AngelMaker, Whitechapel, Dayshell, Harm, Life Itself, The Damned Things, Our Last Night, New Idea Society, Belle, The Anchor, and Charlatan!

Add on album reviews from:

Attila - Villain - Self-Release

ExitWounds - Visions - EP - SharpTone Records

Blood Youth - Starve - Rude Records

Boundaries - My Body In Bloom - EP - Unbeaten Records

To the Rats and Wolves - Cheap Love - Arising Empire/Nuclear Blast Records

Minors - Abject Bodies - Holy Roar/Deathwish Records

Deadships - D.O.A. - Stay Sick Recordings

Ghost Iris - Apple of Discord - SPV/Long Branch Records

Plus, stuff and/or things and maybe some more!

Every member of Down & Dirty joins Ian in a very fun and very informative episode of Ian Hates Conversations: Music Edition!

Zeke, Jack, Connor, Christian, and Matt join Ian from all over the states to talk about everything Down & Dirty! When I say everything, I mean EVERYTHING!

Down & Dirty are not a band you would necessarily call ‚Äúlucky‚Äù in the music business, but they‚Äôre still here fighting to create their debut album even after going through what they went through. I for one can‚Äôt wait to hear it! Make sure to check out the link to the Indiegogo below.

Think you know the whole story behind the band?

Think just because you know this is the band that Denis Stoff created after Make Me Famous means you know it all?

It‚Äôs cliche but think again!

Here‚Äôs Down & Dirty‚Äôs story directly from the people involved.

You‚Äôre in for a fun one!

Make sure to support Down & Dirty by following the links below:

Down & Dirty - Indiegogo

Down & Dirty - Facebook

Down & Dirty - Twitter

Down & Dirty - Instagram

Really big thanks to all the members of Down & Dirty for taking the time to be on the show! Make sure you support them in creating their very first album by donating to their Indiegogo! You know I will!

Don't forget to support Ian Hates Music! Subscribe, rate, and share Ian Hates Music on iTunes, Stitcher, Google Play Music, SoundCloud, and any of your favorite podcast listening apps! Plus, please check out the new Patreon link and support the shows even more!

Long days and pleasant nights.

Ready for a really fun Ian Hates Music episode?

Ready for a clusterfuck of an Ian Hates Music episode?

Then you‚Äôre in luck on both counts!

It‚Äôs a brand new Ian Hates Music: Friday Edition! That means the guys don‚Äôt care about editing and just shoot the shit about the scene and anything they want to talk about. Plus, meet the newest member of Ian Hates Music! But, you‚Äôll have to listen to find out who it is‚Ä¶

What a tease!

Get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, and really, all the core you could ever want!

It's another FUCKING GREAT, FUCKING FREE (NSFW) episode of Ian Hates Music you say?!?! That's right! Ian, Dave, and (?) talk your scene news from:

Code Orange, Slaves and Jonny Craig, Warped Tour, Norma Jean, As I Lay Dying, Bring Me The Horizon, Emarosa, Senses Fail, and Attila!

PS - There are some harsh words used to explain the situation with Senses Fail and Attila.

And New Songs talk from:

Periphery, Vanish, Kingdom of Giants, My Immortal Enemy, and Red Handed Denial!

Oh my goodness gracious! It‚Äôs another Ian Hates Music Anniversary Show‚Ä¶Part 2! For Part 2, Ian welcomes back longtime producer of Ian Hates Music, Ty Rock City!

Ian and Ty briefly talk about some topics of 2018 (as you do on an anniversary show). They also delve into the ‚Äúcontroversy‚Äù with The Amity Affliction, and Ty gives us his Top 10 albums of 2018! And, there‚Äôs still some more fun to be had!

All you gotta do is push that ‚Äòplay‚Äô button‚Ä¶

Make sure to support Ty with everything he does by following the link below:

Ty Rock City Blog:

Ty Rock City

Big thanks to Ty for taking the time out to be on the show. Make sure to check out his great photography of some great bands and hopefully you‚Äôll run into him at a show!

Dave returns on NYE to talk about the scene with Ian and share some of his lists from 2018! Do you even need more intro than that?

But also get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, and really, all the core you could ever want!

It's another FUCKING GREAT, FUCKING FREE (NSFW) episode of Ian Hates Music you say?!?! That's right! Ian and Dave talk your scene news from:

Warped Tour, Five Finger Death Punch (gross), The Amity Affliction, Tonight Alive (blah), The Devil Wears Prada, and Attila!

Add on an album reviews from:

Palisades - Erase The Pain - Rise Records

Plus, stuff and/or things, and maybe some more!

It‚Äôs a very cool Ian Hates Conversations: Music Edition featuring Toli Borisov from Wildways, all the way from Russia!

Living here in America and you don‚Äôt know Wildways? Well, it‚Äôs time to change that! Time to meet one of the biggest bands in Russia who also happen to be electronicore/metalcore! Worried it‚Äôll be a tough interview because of the language barrier? Don‚Äôt worry about that either! Toli speaks English better than most people Ian knows in the states, haha.

Toli joins Ian all the way from Russia to talk about their sophomore album ‚ÄòDay X‚Äô available through Pale Chord Music, the background of the band, singing in English and Russian, politics, and more!
